physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At 15.9 years of age, the proband was referred with delayed puberty and poor growth. He was normosmic with no associated features of note. Physical examination results included G4, P4, A1 stages, with 6- and 8-cc testes by 17.1 years of age. By 17.9 years, he had ratings of G5, P5, A2, with 12- and 15-cc testes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The proband progressed through puberty appropriately after a short course of oxandrolone and testosterone undecanoate. By adulthood, he reported reduced libido and had reduced bone mineral density, with borderline oligospermia (18 million sperm/ml, 67% abnormal forms, 60% motility).

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At 11.7 years, the younger brother was referred for concerns about short stature and was prepubertal (G3, P3, A1, 2-cc testes bilaterally) at 15.5 years.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Despite a course of testosterone undecanoate, he showed no spontaneous pubertal development by 15.5 years and required ongoing testosterone replacement therapy. He had subnormal testosterone after stopping treatment, with reduced bone mineral density.
